intro: Desmopsis confusa, commonly known as the roughleaf desmopsis, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
